subject: Re: Junit test terminated with no results or errors
msgSnippet: I checked and there is no System.exit() in the code under test.  I also ran your testcase, and the results are similar but different. In both cases, I see the
messageBody:
I checked and there is no System.exit() in the code under test. I
also ran your testcase, and the results are similar but different.
In both cases, I see the console showing only <terminated..>. But
in your test case, the JUnit panel in eclipse shows the test being
run and the bar progresses. In my test case, the JUnit panel shows
nothing being run and there is no progress bar. All it says at the
top of the JUnit panel is "Launching TestLocalUserMapperService..."
Then, the console show that the test has terminated.

I believe my test case is okay because it worked previously. I can
also run the same test case on my home computer. But it does not
work on my office computer. I can't figure out what exactly is
causing eclipse or Junit to not function. Is there something that
it depends on?

When I try to debug the test case, it says "Could not connect to
VM. Socket closed."

Thanks,
yck


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Joakim Ohlrogge"
<joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
> Any System.exit() in the code under test?
>
> I wrote this testcase in order to test that theory:
>
> package se.apoteket.etc;
>
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
> public class TestSystemExit extends TestCase {
> public void testSystemExitTerminatesTestRun() throws Exception
{
> System.exit(0);
> }
> }
>
>
> Try and run it and see if the result is comparable to what you are
> experienceing.
>
> Good luck!
> /Joakim Ohlrogge
>
> On 8/22/07, ycko99 <ycko@...> wrote:
> >
> > I recently ran into a problem when running JUnit test in
Eclipse 3.2
> > and 3.3 The JUnit test shows <terminated....> with no error
messages
> > or results indicating success, failure, or error. I am completely
> > stumped. The eclipse log shows nothing either. Anyone have any
> > ideas?
> >
> >
> >
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
